title: Dow Jones closes at record high, briefly tops 32,000
summary: Australian shares are set to recoup most of Wednesday’s losses as US stocks reset higher. The Dow rose 425 points, after shares in Boeing surged.
author: Timothy Moore

heading: Australian shares are poised to open higher as Federal Reserve chairman Jerome Powell reassured investors that inflation is not a threat, that interest rates will remain at low levels and that Fed will continue to buy assets for “some time”.
ASX futures were up 44 points or 0.7 per cent to 6771 near 8am AEDT, retracing most of Wednesday’s 0.9pc slide. The currency rose 0.8pc, rallying towards US80¢. The NZ dollar leapt 1.5pc to US74.47¢.
